docs.snippet: BUSSEL--Irving, died November 1, 2014. He was born on July 17, 1926 in Plainfield, NJ. His parents were the late Max and Sarah Bussel. Irving attended New York University and the New School of Social Research. He was a Research Editor for the Anti...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUSSEL--Irving, died November 1, 2014. He was born on July 17, 1926 in Plainfield, NJ. His parents were the late Max and Sarah Bussel. Irving attended New York University and the New School of Social Research. He was a Research Editor for the Anti Defamation League in New York for over 40 years. He is survived by a brother, Eli Bussell of Edison, NJ, a sister, Roselyn Ramist of Stamford, CT, and nieces and nephews Lisa, Frank, Joanne, Lauren, and Jordan.

docs.snippet: BENNETT--William. Sometimes words cannot express a loss, measure a life, or convey how much one person has given us. We, his colleagues at the Saltaire Volunteer Fire Company, grieve our dear friend, Will Bennett. But his spirit remains, cherished...
docs.lead_paragraph: BENNETT--William. Sometimes words cannot express a loss, measure a life, or convey how much one person has given us. We, his colleagues at the Saltaire Volunteer Fire Company, grieve our dear friend, Will Bennett. But his spirit remains, cherished and kept safe in the hearts of those who knew and loved him. A memorial service for Will Bennett will be held Thursday, November 6, 2014, at the Church of the Heavenly Rest, 2 East 90th Street (corner of 5th Avenue). In lieu of flowers the family requests that donations in Will's name be sent to: Saltaire Volunteer Fire Company, PO Box 5375, Bay Shore, NY 11706. Hugh O'Brien, President James Rieger, Chief

docs.snippet: BENNETT--William Stephen, of Bronxville, New York died on October 29, 2014. His family and many close friends will miss him deeply. A service will be held on November 6 at 4pm at the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest in New York City. In lieu ...

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  BENNETT, WILLIAM STEPHEN

docs.lead_paragraph: BENNETT--William Stephen, of Bronxville, New York died on October 29, 2014. His family and many close friends will miss him deeply. A service will be held on November 6 at 4pm at the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest in New York City. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Saltaire Volunteer Fire Co., Bay Shore, NY.

docs.snippet: APPEL--Beatrice H.,of New York City, on November 1, 2014, in her 105th year. Daughter of Samuel L. and Eva Hoffman, she had been married to Alfred for 69 years. She was a graduate of Adelphi Academy, attended Adelphi College, and was a graduate of...

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  APPEL, BEATRICE H.

docs.lead_paragraph: APPEL--Beatrice H.,of New York City, on November 1, 2014, in her 105th year. Daughter of Samuel L. and Eva Hoffman, she had been married to Alfred for 69 years. She was a graduate of Adelphi Academy, attended Adelphi College, and was a graduate of the American Academy of Dramatic Arts. For four years she was a volunteer guide at the United Nations in Lake Success, and spent twenty-four years as a docent at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, specializing in Egyptology, about which she was passionate. She also loved studying and teaching art history, and taught English to Russian emigres. She was an elegant, bright, and dynamic lady, who adored her family and is survived by her children, Prof. Nina S. Appel (late Alfred, Jr.), Betty and Paul Schaffer, and John S. Appel and Barbara Wolkowitz, her grandchildren Karen and Gene Oshman, Richard J. Appel, Dr. Mark A. Schaffer and David Goldman, and Catherine and Michael Rose, and her great-grandchildren Stephen and Katherine, Gabriel and Grace, and Andrew and Jenna. Also surviving is her devoted brother, Dr. Burton P. Hoffman, and his family. Services on Thursday, November 6, 2014, 10am, at Frank E. Campbell, 1076 Madison Ave. at 81st St.
